Dear Mr. Smith:
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced facility completed on
January 26, 2023. The inspection has determined substantial compliance with applicable
licensing statutes and rules.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact Kari Muntean, Area Manager, at 734-395-0920.
Sincerely,
Douglas W Turrill, Licensing Consultant

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules.
2.) This facility is non-contracted therefore, MISEP requirements are not applicable.
3.) MDHHS Contract: The agency is non-contracted therefore the MDHHS contact is
not applicable.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
The agency was informed that under ACT NO. 116 OF THE PUBLIIC ACTS OF
1973, AS AMENDED Effective March 28, 2018, all Licensing Rules for Child
Placing Agencies apply to a licensed CPA agency. The Court Administrator, who is
also the Chief Administrator of the agency, was provided the reference in PA 116
which defines a CPA agency and its responsibilities under the act.
The agency reported that they have a non-responsive foster home whose license
expired in January 2023. The Chief Administrator and home licensor were advised
to send the foster parent a formal letter informing them that their license will be
closed if the home remains non-responsive to requests from the agency for contact.
The DCWL corrective action form with instructions were provided to the Chief
Administrator.
V. CONSULTATION
Consultation was not required or requested at this time.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this
licensing period.
The agency was not required to submit a corrective action plan during the licensing
period. There were no complaints filed against the agency during the licensing
period.
Chief Administrators Assessment: The assessment noted that the agency
remains in compliance with licensing rules. The assessment noted that an agency
foster home is in non-compliance as they are not responding to requests from the
agency to conduct a renewal inspection of the home. The assessment also spoke to
the problem of gaining access to LMS as this is currently an issue for non-contracted
programs.
Interviews: Discussion occurred with the Chief Administrator jointly with the
program licensing supervisor. They discussed recruitment efforts that have been
conducted and their desire to obtain foster homes. The home licensor reported that
3

she has obtained certification and complaint training. Discussion also involved
whether Part 4. Foster Care Services, pertains to government operated programs.
Technical assistance was provided.
VII. CPA ANALYST FINDINGS: The agency is a non-contracted Court operated agency
therefore the CPA Analyst was not required to be involved in the auditing process.
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules. It is recommended that the facility continue on a regular license.
February 7, 2023

Douglas W Turrill Date
